events.originalText: An explosion at the Evangelos Florakis Naval Base killed 13 people, including the head of the Cyprus Navy.
events.subtitle: Evangelos Florakis Naval Base explosion
events.headline: Explosion at Evangelos Florakis Naval Base kills 13, including head of Cyprus Navy

events.originalText: The Islamist militia group Al-Shabaab carried out multiple suicide bombings in Kampala, Uganda, killing 74 people and injuring 85 others.
events.subtitle: Islamism
events.headline: Al-Shabaab carries out suicide bombings in Kampala, Uganda, killing 74

events.originalText: Shortly after taking off from Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, Nigeria Airways Flight 2120 caught fire and crashed, killing all 261 people on board.
events.subtitle: Jeddah
events.headline: Nigeria Airways Flight 2120 catches fire and crashes, killing all 261 on board

events.originalText: To Kill a Mockingbird, a novel by Harper Lee featuring themes of racial injustice and the loss of innocence in the Deep South of America, was published.
events.subtitle: To Kill a Mockingbird
events.headline: Harper Lee's novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird' published

events.originalText: New York City's Triborough Bridge (pictured), the "biggest traffic machine ever built", opened to traffic.
events.subtitle: Robert F. Kennedy Bridge
events.headline: Triborough Bridge in New York City opens to traffic

events.originalText: Ukrainian archaeologist Ivan Borkovský discovered a medieval skeleton at Prague Castle, competing factions claimed the skeleton as Germanic or Slavic in origin.
events.subtitle: Ivan Borkovský
events.headline: Medieval skeleton discovered at Prague Castle by Ukrainian archaeologist

events.originalText: American Civil War: Confederate forces under Jubal Early began an unsuccessful attempt to capture Washington, D.C..
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate forces under Jubal Early attempt to capture Washington, D.C.

events.originalText: 'A riot broke out in Leicester, England, at the failed launching of a hot air balloon.
events.subtitle: Leicester balloon riot
events.headline: Riot breaks out in Leicester, England, at failed hot air balloon launch

events.originalText: London Waterloo station, Britain's busiest railway station by passenger usage, was opened by the London and South Western Railway.
events.subtitle: London Waterloo station
events.headline: London Waterloo station opened by London and South Western Railway

events.originalText: British soldier Frederick John White died after a flogging, leading to a campaign to end the practice in the British Army.
events.subtitle: Death of Frederick John White
events.headline: British soldier Frederick John White dies after flogging, sparking campaign to end practice

events.originalText: Yagan, a Noongar warrior wanted for leading attacks on British colonists in Western Australia, was killed, becoming a symbol of the unjust and sometimes brutal treatment of indigenous Australians by colonial settlers.
events.subtitle: Yagan
events.headline: Noongar warrior Yagan killed in Western Australia, symbolizing treatment of indigenous Australians

events.originalText: French astronomer Jean-Louis Pons co-discovered the first of his 37 comets, more than any other person in history.
events.subtitle: Jean-Louis Pons
events.headline: French astronomer Jean-Louis Pons co-discovers first of 37 comets

events.originalText: The Belfast Harp Festival, an early event in the Gaelic revival, began at the Assembly Rooms.
events.subtitle: Belfast Harp Festival
events.headline: Belfast Harp Festival begins, early event in Gaelic revival

events.originalText: French Revolution: Jacques Necker was dismissed as Director-General of Finances of France, sparking public demonstrations in Paris that led to the storming of the Bastille.
events.subtitle: French Revolution
events.headline: Jacques Necker dismissed as Director-General of Finances of France, sparking public demonstrations

events.originalText: Marking the start of Ming China's treasure voyages, an expeditionary fleet led by Zheng He (depicted) set sail for foreign regions of the South China Sea and the Indian Ocean.
events.subtitle: Ming dynasty
events.headline: Expeditionary fleet led by Zheng He sets sail for Ming China's treasure voyages

events.originalText: Franco-Flemish War: Flemish infantry defeated a large French army near Kortrijk at the Battle of the Golden Spurs.
events.subtitle: Franco-Flemish War
events.headline: Flemish infantry defeats French army at Battle of the Golden Spurs
